oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Regarding some Bushman dialects. By lhan=kasso (L VIII.-19. 7672-7675). |han=kass'o comments on his understanding of other |xam dialects, spoken by 'Berg (Mountain) Bushmen' and 'River Bed people'. He can understand their language (=kakken-=kakken) even when it is different, because they are his fellows. The language spoken by another group (the |ke |ke ||en) resembles that spoken by the Nama.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: |xam dialects ('Berg Bushmen' and 'River Bed people')
